em.strong: If you are in need of immediate assistance (if you, or your child, is unsafe and in immediate crisis), call 911.

span.a: El Dorado County Emergency & Crisis Services (2-1-1)

div.p: El Dorado County Behavioral Health psychiatric emergency services crisis line: (530) 544-2219 (available 24/7)
Disaster Distress Helpline: call 1-800-985-5990 or text TalkWithUs to 66746 for help in English or Spanish
Live Violence Free 24-hour crisis line: (530) 544-4444
Suicide Prevention Lifeline 1-800-273-8255 (available 24/7)
National Suicide Hotline: 1-800-SUICIDE
National Suicide Textline: Text the word HOPE to (916) 668-iCAN
National Suicide Crisis Chat: suicideprevention.wellspacehealth.org
LTUSD Triage: available everyday by email at eruiz@ltusd.org, or from 8:00am-1:30pm Tuesdays and Thursdays by phone: 541-2850 ext. 0 (Se Habla Espanol)

span.a: County Behavioral Health, South Lake Tahoe office:

span.style: font-family: Open Sans; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

span.a: A Balanced Life Teletherapy

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: A Balanced Life SMART Recovery meetings facilitated by Marcella Araiza, LMFT, every Tuesday from 6:00 - 7:00 pm. Free to anyone in the community wanting support with any kind of addiction using science backed methodologies and strategies. Join via Zoom (click link above or use Meeting ID: 605-789-868).

span.a: Family Resource Center
Live Violence Free therapy, support, and advocacy programs
Tahoe Youth and Family Services: Mental Health and Substance Abuse services

div.p: A Balanced Life Helping the Helpers group. A weekly support group for those in a helping profession during the Coronavirus pandemic. Every Thursday starting 4/23, 1:00 - 2:00 pm with Lindsay Simon, LMFT. Access this weekly meeting by clicking here or use Meeting ID: 712-2974-0117 once you're signed into Zoom.
